00007 /* 
00008  * flushBuffer
00009  *
00010  * Flushes stdin to remove any leftover characters
00011  * which may still be lying around
00012  */
00013 void flushBuffer(void);
00014 
00015 /*
00016  * readChar
00017  *
00018  * Wrapper around readValue to read a single character (and
00019  * make sure no more than one character was passed).
00020  * Returns 0 if everything was OK, and -1 otherwise.
00021  */
00022 int readChar(char* c);
00023 
00024 /* 
00025  * readData
00026  *
00027  * Reads the input from the user for one
00028  * artwork only and puts all the obtained data
00029  * into the struct pointed by the parameter pointer.
00030  * Return 1 on error and 0 for OK.
00031  */
00032 int readData(artwork_info *info);
00033 
00034 /*
00035  * readInt
00036  *
00037  * Reads input and checks if it's a valid integer. If not,
00038  * read it until a valid integer is entered.
00039  */
00040 void readInt(const char* inputText, char* dest, size_t length);
00041 
00042 /*
00043  * readString
00044  *
00045  * Read input without much validation. If it is a null entry,
00046  * read it again.
00047  */
00048 void readString(const char* inputText, char* dest, size_t length);
00049 
00050 /*
00051  * readValue
00052  *
00053  * Reads at most length bytes from stdin and
00054  * strips the trailing newline if it is present.
00055  * Otherwise, clear the input buffer before leaving.
00056  */
00057 void readValue(char s[], size_t length);
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * stripNewLine
00061  *
00062  * This function replaces a trailing '\n' character (if it exists)
00063  * in a string with '\0'.
00064  * If a newline character is not found, it flushes the input buffer.
00065  */
00066 void stripNewLine(char s[]);
00067 
00068 /*
00069  * stripWhiteSpace
00070  *
00071  * This function removes trailing whitespaces at the beginning
00072  * and at the end of the string /str/, and also removes duplicate
00073  * whitespaces in the middle of the string.
00074  */
00075 void stripWhiteSpace(char str[]);
